titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank B. Swayze phonograph collection, 1962-1967" MS2174

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Frank B. Swayze phonograph collection
did.abstract: This collection contains twenty phonograph records of the Far East Network of the Armed Forces Radio and Television Service. The material dates from circa 1962 to circa 1967. The records are transcription discs of news programs, including Capitol Cloakroom, From the Capitol, Face the Nation, Issues and Answers, and Meet the Press.
did.physloc: Materials are stored on site. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains twenty phonograph records of the Far East Network of the Armed Forces Radio and Television Service. The material dates from circa 1962 to circa 1967. The records are transcription discs of news programs, including Capitol Cloakroom, From the Capitol, Washington Viewpoint, Face the Nation, Issues and Answers, Meet the Press, and Pin Point. Guests on these programs included U.S. senators, U.S. representatives, ambassadors, and non-elected U.S. officials. The phonograph records were saved from destruction by Capt. Frank Swayze, U.S.N. Ret., while he was stationed at Misawa Air Base in northern Japan (1971-1974). He gave them to GW in 2001.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Capt. Frank B. Swayze, U.S.N. Ret., 08/18/2001

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Organized according to date and disc ID number.

bioghist.head: Biographic/Historical note
bioghist.p: Capt. Frank Benjamin Swayze, U.S.N. Ret., collected the contents of this collection and donated them to GW. Swayze graduated from GW Law School in 1976. Swayze was a captain in the Judge Advocate General's Corp, U.S. Navy. He was stationed at Misawa Air Base in northern Japan from 1971-1974. Before retirement, Swayze worked at the Pentagon in the Office of the Judge Advocate General, International Law Division, and in the Office of the Secretary of Defense (International Security Affairs).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.
